Information Architecture for Developer Portal Rebuild (DPR)
Users must have intuitive navigation, search, metadata, and UI labeling so they can find what they need
Users must have a homepage so they can easily access all content on the website
Users must have an easy way to browse and search for content for each VMware product
Users must have an a single page where they can access all technical resources (API Explorer, Sample Exchange, Docs, SDKs, etc.)
Users must have an easy way to find all community resources
Users must have a Programs area so they can get to partner and community program information
Users must have an easy way to provide actionable feedback about the website and content
Users must have a Support area so they can find paid support and self-help resources
Users must have a frictionless way to create an account, sign in to the website, and access entitlements and personalized features
Users must have a Tutorial Exchange so they can find, consume, curate, and contribute tutorials (including labs)
Users must have "Subscriptions" (RSS and Web hooks) so they can connect any content type as a service to other platforms
Users should have AVA integration for automatic content categorization, recommendations, answers to common questions, etc.
Users should have Activity Paths so they engage with curated collections of content in an orderly manner to achieve an objective.

Users must have an In-Product Developer Experience that is consistent with the website developer experience so they can access information resources everywhere, from a single source of truth, and without having to learn multiple mental models.
